00046 #include "ssc_usart.h"
00047 
00048 typedef struct ssc_uart_opt_tag {
00049     int baud_rate;
00050     char stop_bits;
00051     char parity;
00052     char char_len;
00053     char parity_error;
00054     char framing_error;
00055     char overrun_error;
00056 } ssc_uart_opt_t;
00057 
00061 static ssc_uart_opt_t opt;
00062 
00063 
00075 static int has_even_parity(unsigned short ch)
00076 {
00077     int count_1s = 0;
00078 
00079     while( ch > 0 )
00080     {
00081         if ( ch & 0x1 )
00082             count_1s++;
00083 
00084         ch = ch >> 1;
00085     }
00086 
00087     return (count_1s % 2 == 0);
00088 }
00089 
00101 static int get_parity_bit(unsigned short ch)
00102 {
00103     if (opt.parity == SSC_UART_PARITY_NONE)
00104         return 0;
00105     else if (opt.parity == SSC_UART_PARITY_SPACE)
00106         return 0;
00107     else if (opt.parity == SSC_UART_PARITY_MARK)
00108         return 1;
00109     else if (opt.parity == SSC_UART_PARITY_EVEN)
00110     { // Parity Even
00111         if ( has_even_parity(ch) )
00112             return 0;
00113         else
00114             return 1;
00115     }
00116     else
00117     { // Parity Odd
00118         if ( has_even_parity(ch) )
00119             return 1;
00120         else
00121             return 0;
00122     }
00123 }
00124 
00131 static int get_stop_bits()
00132 {
00133     if (opt.stop_bits == SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE_AND_HALF)
00134         return 0x3; // binary: 11
00135     else if (opt.stop_bits == SSC_UART_STOPBITS_TWO)
00136         return 0x3; // binary: 11
00137     else // if (opts->stop_bits == SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE)
00138         return 0x1;
00139 }
00140 
00153 static int setClockDivider( volatile avr32_ssc_t * ssc,
00154     unsigned int bit_rate,
00155     long pbaHz )
00156 {
00159   ssc->cmr = ((unsigned int) (pbaHz / ( bit_rate*2 ))
00160     <<AVR32_SSC_CMR_DIV_OFFSET);
00161 
00162   return SSC_UART_SUCCESS;
00163 }

00173 static void ssc_uart_reset(volatile avr32_ssc_t  *ssc)
00174 {
00175       ssc->cr = AVR32_SSC_CR_SWRST_MASK;
00176 }

00178 
00179 int ssc_uart_init(volatile avr32_ssc_t  *ssc, int baud_rate, int stop_bits, int parity_bits,
00180   int char_len,int loop_back,long pbaHz )
00181 {
00182 
00183     // Check arguments
00184     if ( baud_rate < 0 )
00185         return SSC_UART_BAD_ARGS ;
00186 
00187     if ( stop_bits < 0 || stop_bits > SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE_AND_HALF )
00188         return SSC_UART_BAD_ARGS ;
00189 
00190     if ( parity_bits < 0 || parity_bits > SSC_UART_PARITY_MARK )
00191         return SSC_UART_BAD_ARGS ;
00192 
00193     if ( char_len < 5 || char_len > 9 )
00194         return SSC_UART_BAD_ARGS ;
00195 
00196     // Store arguments
00197     opt.baud_rate = baud_rate;
00198     opt.stop_bits = stop_bits;
00199     opt.parity= parity_bits;
00200     opt.char_len = char_len;
00201     opt.framing_error = 0;
00202     opt.parity_error = 0;
00203     opt.overrun_error = 0;
00204 
00205     // Reset SSC:
00206     ssc_uart_reset(ssc);
00207 
00208     // Set SSC internal clock frequency
00209     setClockDivider(ssc, baud_rate,pbaHz );
00210 
00211     // Set transmit clock mode:
00212     //   CKS - use divided clock, CKO - continuous transmit clock,
00213     //   CKI - shift data on falling clock, START - immediately after data
00214     //   is inserted in THR. STTDLY, PERIOD - not used.
00215     ssc->tcmr =
00216              (0<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_CKS_OFFSET)|
00217              (2<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_CKO_OFFSET)|
00218              (0<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_CKG_OFFSET)|
00219              (1<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_CKI_OFFSET)|
00220              (0<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_START_OFFSET)|
00221              (0<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_STTDLY_OFFSET)|
00222              (0<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_PERIOD_OFFSET);
00223 
00224     // Set transmit frame mode:
00225     //  DATNB - Transfer one word, MSBF - transmit lsb first,
00226     //  DATDEF - Default to one, FSEDGE, FSDEN, FSOS, FSLEN  - not used,
00227     //  DATLEN - stop_bits+parity_bits+char_length
00228     //  (If stopbits=1.5, transmit two)
00229     ssc->tfmr =
00230             ( ( (stop_bits==SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE?1:2) + (parity_bits==0?0:1) + char_len ) << AVR32_SSC_TFMR_DATLEN_OFFSET )|
00231             (1<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_DATDEF_OFFSET)|
00232             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_MSBF_OFFSET)|
00233             (1<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_DATNB_OFFSET)|
00234             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_FSLEN_OFFSET)|
00235             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_FSOS_OFFSET)|
00236             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_FSDEN_OFFSET)|
00237             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_FSEDGE_OFFSET);
00238 
00239     // Set receive clock mode:
00240     //   CKS - use divided clock, CKO - continuous transmit clock,
00241     //   CKI - shift data on falling edge, START - immediately after data
00242     //   STOP - wait for new compare 0 after finishing transfer,
00243     //   STTDLY, PERIOD - not used
00244     ssc->rcmr =
00245           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKS_OFFSET)|
00246           (2<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKO_OFFSET)|
00247           (1<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKI_OFFSET)|
00248           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKG_OFFSET)|
00249           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_START_OFFSET)|
00250           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_STOP_OFFSET)|
00251           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_STTDLY_OFFSET)|
00252           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_PERIOD_OFFSET);
00253 
00254     // Set receive frame mode:
00255     //   DATLEN - stop_bits+start_bits+parity_bits+char_len,
00256     //   (if 1.5 stop bits just take one)
00257     //   LOOP - YES loopback, MSBF - lsb first, DATNB - transmit one per sync,
00258     //   FSLEN - 1 bit (start bit), FSOS, FSEDGE - not used
00259     ssc->rfmr =
00260               ( ( (stop_bits==0?0:1) +1 +(parity_bits==0?0:1) +char_len ) <<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_DATLEN_OFFSET )|
00261               ((loop_back==SSC_UART_LOOPBACK_MODE_ENABLE?1:0)<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_LOOP_OFFSET)|
00262               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_MSBF_OFFSET)|
00263               (1<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_DATNB_OFFSET)|
00264               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_FSLEN_OFFSET)|
00265               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_FSOS_OFFSET)|
00266               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_FSEDGE_OFFSET);
00267 
00268 
00269     // Set compare 0-register
00270     ssc->rc0r = (0<<AVR32_SSC_RC0R_CP0_OFFSET);
00271 
00272     // Enable receiver and transceiver
00273     ssc->cr = (1<<AVR32_SSC_CR_TXEN_OFFSET)|(1<<AVR32_SSC_CR_RXEN_OFFSET);
00274     return SSC_UART_SUCCESS;
00275 }
00276 
00289 static int ssc_uart_validate(unsigned short ch)
00290 {
00291     int data;
00292     int parity_bit=0;
00293     int stop_bits;
00294 
00295     // Get stop bit(s)
00296     if (opt.parity == SSC_UART_PARITY_NONE)
00297         stop_bits = ch >> (opt.char_len) ;
00298     else
00299         stop_bits = ch >> (opt.char_len+1) ;
00300 
00301     // If the first stop bit is not one, we have a frame error.
00302     //   Does not check second stop bit, even if n_stop_bits>=2
00303     if ((stop_bits & 0x1) == 0)
00304     {
00305         opt.framing_error = 1;
00306         return SSC_UART_FAILURE;
00307     }
00308 
00309     // Gets the parity bit
00310     parity_bit = ((ch >> (opt.char_len)) & 0x1) ;
00311 
00312     // Gets only useful data
00313     data = ch & 0xFF;
00314 
00315     // If parity is enabled, and the parity bit differs from what it
00316     //   should be, we have a parity error
00317     if (opt.parity != SSC_UART_PARITY_NONE &&
00318       get_parity_bit(data) != parity_bit)
00319     {
00320         opt.parity_error = 1;
00321         return SSC_UART_FAILURE;
00322     }
00323 
00324     // Return char_len lsb of ch
00325      return (ch & ((1<<opt.char_len)-1)) ;
00326 }
00327 
00328 
00329 
00330 int ssc_uart_putchar(volatile avr32_ssc_t  *ssc, unsigned short ch)
00331 {
00332     unsigned int word = 0 ;
00333     int timeout = SSC_UART_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;
00334 
00335     // Shift data one bit right (because of start-bit) and put in word
00336     //   The left-most bit is always zero, and is the start-bit
00337     word = (ch) << 1 ;
00338 
00339     // If parity-bit, find it, shift it past data and start-bit, and add.
00340     //   Then add stop bits after that.
00341     if (opt.parity != SSC_UART_PARITY_NONE)
00342         word |= (get_parity_bit(ch) << (opt.char_len+1)) |
00343           (get_stop_bits() << (opt.char_len+2));
00344 
00345     // If no parity bit, add stop bit after data.
00346     else
00347         word |= (get_stop_bits() << (opt.char_len+1));
00348 
00349     // wait for Transmit ready
00350         while( ( ssc->sr & (1<<AVR32_SSC_SR_TXRDY_OFFSET) ) == 0 &&
00351             timeout > 0 ) {
00352           timeout--;
00353         }
00354 
00355     // If timeout, return TIMEOUT
00356     if (timeout == 0)
00357         return SSC_UART_TIMEOUT;
00358 
00359     // Write word to transmit holding register
00360     ssc->thr = word ;
00361 
00362     return SSC_UART_SUCCESS;
00363 }
00364 
00365 int ssc_uart_getchar(volatile avr32_ssc_t  *ssc)
00366 {
00367 
00368     // If overrun, set overrun_error flag and return
00369     if (ssc->SR.ovrun)
00370     {
00371         opt.overrun_error = 1;
00372         return SSC_UART_FAILURE;
00373     }
00374 
00375     // busy-loop until data arrives
00376     while (!ssc->SR.rxrdy)
00377         ;
00378 
00379     // validate data and return
00380     return( ssc_uart_validate(ssc->rhr) ) ;
00381 
00382 }
00383 
00384 
00385 void ssc_uart_reset_status(volatile avr32_ssc_t  * ssc)
00386 {
00387     opt.parity_error = 0;
00388     opt.framing_error = 0;
00389     opt.overrun_error = 0;
00390 }
00391 
00392 
00393 int ssc_uart_parity_error(volatile avr32_ssc_t  * ssc)
00394 {
00395     return opt.parity_error;
00396 }
00397 
00398 
00399 int ssc_uart_framing_error(volatile avr32_ssc_t  * ssc)
00400 {
00401     return opt.framing_error;
00402 }
00403 
00404 
00405 int ssc_uart_overrun_error(volatile avr32_ssc_t  * ssc)
00406 {
00407     return opt.overrun_error;
00408 }
